title: Bug 6410: File marked as dirtied by code assist without actual changes
description: The file remains unaltered, yet it is marked as 'dirtied' after using code assist.
OB: Upon using code assist, the file is flagged as 'dirtied' despite no actual modifications occurring. Additionally, the code assist feature fails to appear.
EB: The file should not be marked as 'dirtied' when no changes are made through code assist. Moreover, the code assist functionality should trigger and display properly.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call (e.g., consider 'I' to be the cursor below: Object o = anotherObject.method(I);)
3. Press Ctrl + Space to activate code assist.
